about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should:

about.name: To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should:

hasPart.assesses: To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should: | To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Slow down before you enter a curve because you do not know what may be ahead. Braking on a curve may cause you to skid.

suggestedAnswer.text: Shift to a lower gear after starting down a steep hill.

comment.text: Shift to a lower gear after starting down a steep hill.

suggestedAnswer.text: Speed up to enter curves and slow down to exit them.

comment.text: Speed up to enter curves and slow down to exit them.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down before entering curves and intersections.

comment.text: Slow down before entering curves and intersections.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down before entering curves and intersections.

comment.text: Slow down before entering curves and intersections.

answerExplanation.text: Slow down before you enter a curve because you do not know what may be ahead. Braking on a curve may cause you to skid.

comment.text: To help avoid skidding on slippery surfaces, you should: | Slow down before you enter a curve because you do not know what may be ahead. Braking on a curve may cause you to skid.

hasPart.name: What does this road sign mean?

about.name: What does this road sign mean?

hasPart.assesses: What does this road sign mean? | What does this road sign mean? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that you are approaching a steep hill. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

comment.text: Falling rocks
Trucks use second gear
Steep hill
Steep hill

answerExplanation.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that you are approaching a steep hill. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

comment.text: What does this road sign mean? | Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that you are approaching a steep hill. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: What does this road sign mean? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: What does this road sign mean?

hasPart.name: Dim your headlights for oncoming vehicles or when you are within 300 feet of a vehicle:

about.name: Dim your headlights for oncoming vehicles or when you are within 300 feet of a vehicle:

hasPart.assesses: Dim your headlights for oncoming vehicles or when you are within 300 feet of a vehicle: | Dim your headlights for oncoming vehicles or when you are within 300 feet of a vehicle: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You are required to dim your headlights to low beams within 500 feet of a vehicle that is coming toward you and within 300 feet of a vehicle that you are following.

suggestedAnswer.text: That you are approaching from behind.

comment.text: That you are approaching from behind.
Approaching you from behind.
That you have already passed.

acceptedAnswer.text: That you are approaching from behind.

comment.text: That you are approaching from behind.

answerExplanation.text: You are required to dim your headlights to low beams within 500 feet of a vehicle that is coming toward you and within 300 feet of a vehicle that you are following.

comment.text: Dim your headlights for oncoming vehicles or when you are within 300 feet of a vehicle: | You are required to dim your headlights to low beams within 500 feet of a vehicle that is coming toward you and within 300 feet of a vehicle that you are following.

hasPart.name: Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out-of-the-ordinary:

about.name: Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out-of-the-ordinary:

hasPart.assesses: Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out-of-the-ordinary: | Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out-of-the-ordinary: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Avoid "rubbernecking," or slowing down to look at collisions or anything else out-of-the-ordinary. This helps to relieve traffic congestion.

comment.text: Causes traffic congestion.
Prevents rear-end collisions.

suggestedAnswer.text: Improves traffic flow by preventing collisions.

comment.text: Improves traffic flow by preventing collisions.
Causes traffic congestion.

answerExplanation.text: Avoid "rubbernecking," or slowing down to look at collisions or anything else out-of-the-ordinary. This helps to relieve traffic congestion.

comment.text: Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out-of-the-ordinary: | Avoid "rubbernecking," or slowing down to look at collisions or anything else out-of-the-ordinary. This helps to relieve traffic congestion.

hasPart.name: Remove all snow, frost, and ice from:

about.name: Remove all snow, frost, and ice from:

hasPart.assesses: Remove all snow, frost, and ice from: | Remove all snow, frost, and ice from: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: It is important that you are able to see clearly through all of your vehicle's windows, including the windshield. Remove all snow, ice, and frost from your vehicle's windows and mirrors before you start to drive.

comment.text: Just the windshield.
All windows.

suggestedAnswer.text: Just the windshield and passenger window.

comment.text: Just the windshield and passenger window.
All windows.

answerExplanation.text: It is important that you are able to see clearly through all of your vehicle's windows, including the windshield. Remove all snow, ice, and frost from your vehicle's windows and mirrors before you start to drive.

comment.text: Remove all snow, frost, and ice from: | It is important that you are able to see clearly through all of your vehicle's windows, including the windshield. Remove all snow, ice, and frost from your vehicle's windows and mirrors before you start to drive.

hasPart.name: What is the purpose of rumble strips?

about.name: What is the purpose of rumble strips?

hasPart.assesses: What is the purpose of rumble strips? | What is the purpose of rumble strips? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Rumble strips create noise and vibrations to warn drowsy or inattentive drivers that they are straying off of the road or are approaching a stop sign or signal.

suggestedAnswer.text: They alert drivers to potential tire problems.

comment.text: They alert drivers to potential tire problems.

suggestedAnswer.text: They test a vehicle's shock absorbers.

comment.text: They test a vehicle's shock absorbers.

suggestedAnswer.text: Through vibration and sound, they alert inattentive drivers to the fact that their vehicles have left the travel lane.

comment.text: Through vibration and sound, they alert inattentive drivers to the fact that their vehicles have left the travel lane.

acceptedAnswer.text: Through vibration and sound, they alert inattentive drivers to the fact that their vehicles have left the travel lane.

comment.text: Through vibration and sound, they alert inattentive drivers to the fact that their vehicles have left the travel lane.

answerExplanation.text: Rumble strips create noise and vibrations to warn drowsy or inattentive drivers that they are straying off of the road or are approaching a stop sign or signal.

comment.text: What is the purpose of rumble strips? | Rumble strips create noise and vibrations to warn drowsy or inattentive drivers that they are straying off of the road or are approaching a stop sign or signal.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: What is the purpose of rumble strips? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: What is the purpose of rumble strips?
